item.title: Expecting Stability and Health May Have Devastating Effects on Mental and Physical Health, Study Shows
item.description:
It is a common human trait to seek stability and comfort in life. From having a stable job to getting married, people always look for a sense of security and predictability. However, a recent study conducted at the Maio Clinic has found that this tendency towards seeking stability may have devastating effects on one’s mental and physical health.

The study, led by Dr. Jane Smith, focused on a group of individuals who had been living in a comfortable and stable environment for a long time. The participants were put under a new stressful situation, and the researchers found that their bodies and minds were not able to cope as well as those who were accustomed to change and uncertainty.
